title: 106_s244
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Lewis and Clark Rural Water System Act of 1999". It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The Act defines key terms related to environmental enhancement, including wetland and wildlife activities, proposals from a specific report, and a feasibility study with a water conservation plan. The curr_chunk discusses terms related to the water supply project, such as incremental cost, member entity, project construction budget, and pumping requirements. These terms are crucial for understanding the financial and operational aspects of the project. The term "pumping and incidental operational requirements" refers to the power needs for intake facilities, pumping stations, water treatment facilities, reservoirs, and pipelines up to water delivery. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The term "water supply project" includes the physical components of the Lewis and Clark Rural Water Project, such as pumping, treatment, distribution facilities, and pipelines. The term "water supply system" includes distribution facilities, pipelines, appurtenant buildings, electrical power transmission facilities, and other necessary pipelines and facilities to meet water supply needs. The term "water supply system" refers to the Lewis and Clark Rural Water System, Inc., a nonprofit corporation established in accordance with a feasibility study. Federal assistance is provided for the water supply system. The Secretary will provide grants to the water supply system for planning and constructing water supply projects in specific counties in South Dakota, Minnesota, and Iowa. Grants will not exceed the authorized funds under section 9. The Secretary will not obligate funds for the construction of the water supply project until the requirements of the National Environmental Policy Act are met, and a final engineering report and water conservation program plan are submitted to Congress at least 90 days before construction begins. Federal assistance will be provided for the initial development of the environmental enhancement component of the water supply system. Mitigation for fish and wildlife losses will be based on ecological equivalency. The use of Pick-Sloan power is authorized. The Western Area Power Administration will provide capacity and energy for irrigation and drainage pumping for the water supply project from May 1 to October 31 each year. The water supply system must operate on a not-for-profit basis and purchase electric service from a qualified preference power supplier. The Western Area Power Administration provides capacity and energy for irrigation and drainage pumping for a water supply project from May 1 to October 31 each year. The water supply system must operate on a not-for-profit basis and purchase electric service from a qualified preference power supplier, with a specific rate schedule in effect. The power supplier must pass through the rate schedule benefit to the water supply system, but can still include other charges for electric service. SEC. 7. This Act does not limit water projects in South Dakota, Iowa, and Minnesota. SEC. 8. Water rights are not affected by this Act. SEC. 9. Cost sharing is addressed. The Secretary provides 80% federal funds for water supply projects, with exceptions for Sioux Falls receiving 50%. Non-federal entities cover the remaining costs. The non-Federal share of costs for water supply projects is 20%, except for Sioux Falls, South Dakota, which has a 50% cost-share. SEC. 10. BUREAU OF RECLAMATION.

The Secretary may authorize the Commissioner of Reclamation to oversee project construction and environmental enhancement for the water supply system. The Commissioner's oversight funds cannot exceed 1% of the total project construction budget. The water supply system is responsible for the project's operation and maintenance.

SEC. 11. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for this Act is set at $223,987,700, with a portion allocated for the initial development of the environmental enhancement component.
